intro: Angolluma commutata subsp. sheilae, commonly known as the Sheilae angolluma, is a perennial herb native to the tropical regions of northern Australia. It belongs to the family Myrtaceae and is characterized by its aromatic leaves and small, clustered flowers. The plant typically grows in sandy or rocky soils and thrives in well-drained environments. It is often found in open woodlands and coastal areas, where it contributes to the local biodiversity. Due to its unique morphology and ecological role, it is of interest to botanists and conservationists alike.
